oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Real photograph postcard of Pvt. Wilson A. Dowdy and fellow soldier
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In this photograph, possibly taken at Camp Jackson, S. C., Pvt. Wilson A. Dowdy posed with another soldier identified as Pvt. Cheek. At the time, Dowdy served in Co. C, 307th Engrs. Dowdy, a farmer from Chapel Hill, Tennessee, later served in Btry. F, 318th FA, 81st Div. He was overseas in France from August 8, 1918 until June 11, 1919. Dowdy was promoted to corporal in February 1918 and to sergeant in October 1918.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dowdy, Wilson A.;
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
